channel.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
channel.description:
[center][size=4][b][u]Torrent Clients 6-In-1[/u][/b] [/size]By GoD[/center]
This is an AiO program that I created with the top 6 best torrent clients. These top 6 include the following:
[ul][li]Azureus[/li] [li]BitComet[/li] [li]BitLord[/li] [li]BitTornado[/li] [li]BitTorrent[/li] [li]uTorrent[/li][/ul]
Also, inside are not just the install setups for each client, but also a website to help you configure and speed up your client so that you get the max potential out of it. There is also a screenshot of each client inside, incase some of you would like to see how these clients look.
This took me quite some time to create and I hope will come in handy to some people out there who are new to torrenting and/or need help setting up their torrent applications.
Screenshots: [img]http://i53.photobucket.com/albums/g62/Omfgurweird_83/6-In-1Start.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i53.photobucket.com/albums/g62/Omfgurweird_83/6-In-1uTorrent.jpg[/img]
Megaupload Download: [code]http://www.megaupload.com/?d=UEE8MOBP[/code]
Rapidshare Download: [code]http://rapidshare.com/files/26113103/Torrent_Clients_6-In-1.rar.html[/code]
~GoD

item.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

im with azureas too

if ur not a dumbass and can configure it right (also tweak a bit of windows so itll stop bottlenecking) can get you fastest speeds ive had

usually around 150 kb/s for most torrents some go up to about 650 kb/s

item.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

DeadBird:

Just because it isn’t open source doesn’t mean it’s crap.

Well, in my opinion it does.

It is a decent client for being closed source, it has so much more potential if it gets opened up though.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
item.dc:creator: @DeadBird DeadBird
item.description:
@DeadBird wrote:

Just because it isn’t open source doesn’t mean it’s crap. I’ve tried many clients and uTorrent was the best.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“lawl”]i thought that was sun and java
…[/quote]

sun and adobe for not making a 64-bit plugin for flash and java

Until uTorrent is open source, it will remain in the crap pile of clients. The best cross-platform client is azureas, the best client for linux is KTorrent.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
item.dc:creator: @sdcit sdcit
item.description:
@sdcit wrote:

Utorrent has given me the fastest download times, nice application though.

item.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

that is why I made a flash version however, Mopar is boycotting flash due to Adobe being lazy and not making a 64-bit browser plugin.

item.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Omfgurweird, post:3, topic:80722”][quote author=lawl link=topic=118551.msg1165069#msg1165069 date=1176696231]
whats the point, just use utorrent
…
[/quote]
“I hope will come in handy to some people out there who are new to torrenting and/or need help setting up their torrent applications.”

Well I pretty much said it right there. Yes, everyone has their own opinions on which client is best, and in this AiO, it gives them the chance to test the top 6 out for themselves. Although I would agree that uTorrent is the best, not everyone thinks the same way.

Thanks for your comments.[/quote]

The main moparisthebest.com/smf banner is larger in size than a utorrent download…

Read full topic

item.title: Torrent Clients 6-In-1
item.dc:creator: @Omfgurweird Omfgurweird
item.description:
@Omfgurweird wrote:

[quote=“lawl”]whats the point, just use utorrent
…[/quote]
“I hope will come in handy to some people out there who are new to torrenting and/or need help setting up their torrent applications.”

Well I pretty much said it right there. Yes, everyone has their own opinions on which client is best, and in this AiO, it gives them the chance to test the top 6 out for themselves. Although I would agree that uTorrent is the best, not everyone thinks the same way.

Thanks for your comments.

Read full topic
